alert.note: Alert for Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 28 at 8:26PM MDT until May 29 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ZONE 247...SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEAST ELBERT COUNTIES... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR ZONE 247...SOUTHERN LINCOLN AND SOUTHEAST ELBERT COUNTIES... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 247. * Timing...Red Flag Warning has expired this evening. A Fire Weather Watch is in effect Sunday afternoon. * Winds...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...10 to 15 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will be likely to spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County
